pullRequest.title: [Exam] Variants: Data model
pullRequest.bodyText:
Checklist

 I tested all changes and all related features with different users (student, tutor, instructor, admin) on the test server https://artemistest.ase.in.tum.de.

Motivation and Context
In order to be able to use Artemis for conducting exams, some adjustments to the data model are required.
Description

 We've implemented all new entities
 We've added DTO classes for all new entities
 We've created the corresponding Liquibase change-log
 We've added corresponding TypeScript classes in the client
 We've clarified everything that has to be discussed
 We've added extends AbstractAuditingEntity to all new entities so that created_date, last_modified, ... are added to the database rows



Additional changes
If exams are available, they are now part of the REST Call /courses/for-dashboard. We optimized the performance here, so please double check that we did not introduce unwanted behavior.
Steps for Testing

Login
Open the course overview, course details and exercises
Check that everything is displayed correctly (please compare this to the current state in develop

commit.message: Create new entities for exam mode
Bidirectional relationship between course and exam
Add getters and setters to new entities
Updated new Entities for Exam Mode
Changed Database Stuff to lower case

nodes.bodyText: please leave this out for now, because we don't need this reference to be bidirectional
why is it an abstract auditing entity? should not be necessary!
I would try to avoid the use of constructors
please remove this attribute. We should rather use an ordered collection for Exam --> ExerciseGroup
Please remove this. It won't be necessary
Please remove this. It won't be necessary
I would try to avoid the use of constructors
why is it an abstract auditing entity? should not be necessary

please use a List and OrderColumn here
Have a look how this is implemented for Result --> Feedback in Result.java:99
I think this is wrong. We should use the id here!
please use id
why do we have AbstractAuditingEntity here? I don't think this is necessary
I would avoid the use of constructors
I would be careful with additional logic like this. Please have a look how this is handled in other places in our code, so that we do not break the consistency
same comment as above
we do not use such converters until now in the code. What would be the advantage?
Can we rename this to numberOfExercisesInExam

please add maxPoints as Integer.
Instructors should define this (e.g. 60) and this should be independent of the exercise groups or exercises.
We can use this as additional validation constraint later on, so that we could display a warning if the instructor tries to generate student exams, but the configuration does not fit.
Keep in mind: each student exam should have the same number of points. This is also important when it comes to the calculation of the grades, which we might support at a later stage directly in Artemis

commit.message: Remove bidirectional mapping from inverse getters and setters
Add OrderColumn annotation for exerciseGroups in Exam
Use id instead of title for hashCode in Exam
Add missing attributes to client models
Move Exam and StudentExam to domain package
Add getter and setter for maxPoints
Remove unwanted tables foreign key constraints

Added boolean flag to exam to mark it as an exam with a specific
exercise group order

Changed connection StudentExam - Exercise from Set to List to support
ordering
Added @OrderColumn to keep order of list

group programming

improve data model and cache

Adapter getters and setters to format used throughout the
codebase
Create default repositories for new exam tables
fix wrong config which prevented server start
Adjust order in all new entities: attributes, references, getters/setters
Remove unique constraint from Exam title

add exam resource and exam service with initial logic for create and update exams

add visible exams to the courses for dashboard call
fix issue with wrong attribute in Exam.java

Merge branch 'exam-mode/variants/data-model' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into exam-mode/variants/data-model
